metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38039 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: When curl retrieves an HTTP response, it stores the incoming headers so that they can be accessed later via the libcurl headers API. However, curl did not have a limit in how many or how large headers it would accept in a response, allowing a malicious server to stream an endless series of headers and eventually cause curl to run out of heap memory.

notes.Note: alexmurray> Vulnerable code exists since 7.83.0 but was an experimental feature not enabled by default and only enabled in 7.84.0. Fixed in upstream release 8.3.0.

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
